clues.text: "Better to reign in hell than serve in heaven" is a sentiment from this Milton epic
In a 1934 speech, this Italian dictator said, "We have buried the putrid corpse of liberty"
In 1996 Bill Clinton told the country, "I still believe in a place called" this, "a place called America"
This director told Francois Truffaut, "What is drama, after all, but life with the dull bits cut out"
From his "Analects": "To go too far is as bad as not to go far enough"
A lobotomy is an operation on the brain; a lobectomy is usually an operation on this body part
From Latin for "draw back", it's a medical tool used to pull away edges of an incision for surgical access
Term for the transplanting of tissue from one part of the body to another, or the tissue itself
6-letter name for the process of treating patients in order of the seriousness of their injuries
Abbreviated P.O., "per os" means to take medication this way

A global fave:
RED CHAD

Made into dressing:
FOR TORQUE

Just grate:
SPEAR MAN

It can be quite pungent:
RUMBLE RIG

Often stretched into sticks:
POOR NOVEL
Bellini's opera "I Capuleti e I Montecchi" tells the same story as this play
Operas with him as the main character include "At the Boar's Head" by Holst & "Sir John in Love" by Vaughan Williams
Edmund Spenser's famous poem has the same title as this Henry Purcell opera based on "A Midsummer Night's Dream"
This Italian composer's opera "Macbeth" from 1847 features the aria "There's Still A Spot There"
This 19th c. French Romantic composer wrote many Shakespearean works, including the opera "Beatrice et Benedict"
The co-anchors of ABC's "Good Morning America" report the news from studios at this square at 44th & Broadway
This Wolf Blitzer CNN  news show shares its name with a White House crisis management center
From 1978 to 2011 "60 Minutes" featured this curmudgeon's short editorial observations on the news & life
"Murder in Pinyon Pines" was a 2015 episode of this "timely" CBS News investigative series
Until 2016 she was "On the Record" covering headlines on Fox News
Removed errors from a computer
A step in preparing a fish to be eaten, sometimes it's done at the table by your waiter
Not owing a penny to anyone
A charming gentleman may be described as this type of man about town
Proved something to be false, like the good folks at snopes.com often do
This Central American nation is often called the "Crossroads of the World"
In 2002 the pres of this country renamed January after himself: Turkmen-Bashi, or "Father of All Turkmen"
Valparaiso & Atacama are among the 15 administrative regions of this South American republic
Its highest point is Njesuthi at an elevation of 11,181 feet near its border with Lesotho
Almost half the population of this 4-letter South Pacific nation is descended from laborers imported from India
The Mesolithic Period is part of the Stone this
Number of days in half a fortnight
In ancient Greece this was the 4-year span between athletic games
It sounds like a heroic poem; Paleocene is one
A period of about 30 years, whether it's "the greatest" one or not
At a 2016 show by this band, Eddie Vedder paid tribute to terminally ill singer Gord Downie of The Tragically Hip
This Dave Grohl band, in 2016: "For the millionth time, we're not breaking up. And nobody's going (bleeping) solo!"
"If you try sometimes, you just might find" this Stones song that played after many of Donald Trump's speeches
clues.response: "You Can't Always Get What You Want"

clues.text: In 1979 500,000 people in Central Park decided this Ric Ocasek band was "Just What I Needed"
This quintet became a temporary quartet on "MTV Unplugged" in 1996 when singer Liam Gallagher had laryngitis
This "White Fang" author's "The Mutiny of the Elsinore" was based in part on his 1912 voyage around Cape Horn
In old age Colette wrote this 1944 novella of a girl raised to be a courtesan, adapted as a movie musical
In 1867 he took a 5-month cruise to the Mediterranean; his newspaper articles sent back home became "The Innocents Abroad"
The curator of the Lahore Museum in the first chapter of "Kim" is based on this author's father, who once held the position
W. Somerset Maugham's childhood was material for the life of orphan Philip Carey in this 1915 novel
Eadweard Muybridge's 1878 photos proved that when this animal runs, all 4 feet are off the ground at 1 point
Dorothea Lange's "Migrant Mother" is an iconic photo of Florence Thompson from this period in U.S. history
Lewis Hine's 1932 book "Men at Work" documented in photographs the construction of this NYC building in 1930
In 1927 this photographer published his first portfolio, "Parmelian Prints of the High Sierras"
A 2016 film about this controversial photographer who died of AIDS in 1989 is subtitled "Look at the Pictures"
Money paid to a shareholder
To understand, or to take into police custody
After Kanye West signed him, singer & pianist John Stephens adopted this last name
The official form of address for an archbishop is "most" this
To haughtily deign to do something

rounds.text: Part of this famous 12-minute opening piece is called "March of the Swiss Soldiers"
